result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald L Pulda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil judgment entered against defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.  (RESTITUTION)

miscConds.notes: Restitution must be paid during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Do not associate with known users of controlled substances. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Defendant must submit a DNA specimen, as required by law, and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 1/2 years bifurcated sentence.  AMENDED 08-20-2018:  CFTS (previous pre-sentence credit not included on defendant's original judgment of conviction)

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  No association with anyone convicted of a drug offense outside of treatment setting.
All outstanding costs and fees ordered at sentencing remain due and owing.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

Defendant Donald L Pulda in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer
Defense has filed bond motion as well. The State does not object to the deft continuing with program through Salvation Army. The second prong is the request to modify bond to allow contact with certain individuals. The State notes this request was previously made and the notes do not indicate if the Court has ruled on these. The State objects to bond modification citing no new information and the relationship of the deft to the persons he is requesting to have contact with.

BTC: Defendant may continue with program through Salvation Army. Bond modification is denied. Defense is to provide proof of graduation  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
